p: Capabilities denote core human entitlements ‘that should be respected and implemented by the governments of all nations, as a bare minimum of what respect for human dignity requires’ (Nussbaum, 2006: 70). The CA allows a wide enough applicability that adheres to multiple theories of human nature and accommodates the value pluralism of liberal societies (Nussbaum, 2006: 70). Capabilities ought to be abstract enough ‘to leave room for the activities of specifying and deliberating by citizens and their legislatures and courts’ but specific enough to offer substantive content (Nussbaum, 2006: 78ff). Thus, the CA sets a minimal threshold of capability levels that all individuals are entitled to, being a minimum of what is required to live a life worthy of human dignity.
